meanings.definition: A woman who holds property or a title from her deceased husband
meanings.sent1: The dowagers inherited the estate from their late husbands.
meanings.sent2: The dowagers were given the deeds to the properties by their deceased spouses.
meanings.sent3: The dowagers joked about becoming accidental landlords after their husbands passed away.
meanings.sent4: The dowagers stood as pillars of strength, carrying on the legacy of their husbands.
meanings.sent5: The dowagers' ownership of the land was a symbol of their enduring love.

meanings.definition: An elderly woman of wealth and social status
meanings.sent1: The dowagers attended the charity gala in elegant gowns.
meanings.sent2: The dowagers were respected for their generosity and grace in the community.
meanings.sent3: The dowagers shared stories of their youth, reminiscing about bygone days.
meanings.sent4: The dowagers' presence at the event added a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The dowagers' opulent lifestyle was the envy of many in town.

meanings.definition: The widow of a man of rank or title
meanings.sent1: The dowagers mourned the loss of their noble husbands.
meanings.sent2: The dowagers were known for their elegance and poise even in grief.
meanings.sent3: The dowagers playfully argued about whose husband held the higher title in life.
meanings.sent4: The dowagers' sorrow was like a shadow cast by the absence of their husbands.
meanings.sent5: The dowagers' presence at the ceremony honored the memory of their esteemed husbands.
